dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val walks after a hastily retreating Kellogg.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened. I’11 tear it down soon as we get home. Val pulls off his helmet, giving us a clear look at his f young, handsome, contained...but mad.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: How about right now. Outside. Take your time. Rest of us’1l go on home, send someone back for you tomorrow. Jarrett walks up -- he’s ten years Val’s senior, cowboy-j steely-eyed. Calmer, wiser. Settled is more like it

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: You know, Jarrett, Val ought to show his tech man a little respect. Jarrett holds up the stolen dish component.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: He just made us one point two. Sounds respectful to me. Val grins and lights a cigarette. Kellogg shakes his head disgruntled, turns and heads towards the bridge. Val star after him, but Jarrett lays a firm hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next time I call abort and you feel like sticking around, I’m leaving without you. Val grins through his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val straps into his seat, cigarette dangling from his mou Jarrett takes a seat across from him as Kellogg buckles i shotgun. ANDERS, the young pilot, takes the wheel. ANDERS. Trajectory’s locked. Translunar injection burn in ten ticks. Put that cigarette out, Val. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val takes a big drag on his cigarette and holds the smok his lungs as he grinds the butt into the wall behind him. ANDERS (CONT’D) Five, four, three, two, one, burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket ports on the back of the ship FLARE. The haule moves out.

dialogues.speaker: HAULER BRIDGE
dialogues.text: As the G’s press him into his seat, Val exhales the cigar smoke in a long, steady stream. Jarrett shakes his head, trying not to smile. Val grins. hard feelings between these two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship cuts a fast course for the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An industrial complex sprawling three Chicagos big across lunar surface. Truck convoys stretch from the complex to horizon; a freeway’s worth of spaceship traffic constantl flies in and out. It’s always rush hour on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, the kid’s back.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mullins, my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark booths and hazy light. Dartboards. Workers come here when their shift is over. Val, Jarrett, Kellogg, Anders sit at a booth in the back, drinking and smoking. MULLINS, baby of the bunch, mop hea tousled hair, cocky smile, exchanges hand shakes and back slaps as slides into the booth.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: How was Mars? Mullins shrugs like it wasn’t much. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbed the ice cliffs below Mount Olympus. Got laid. Twice.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: That’s twice more than Jarrett in as many years. Mullins cracks a shit-eating grin. Val offers him a smoke

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You ready to go back to work? Mullins takes the cigarette, gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: What’s up? Val leans in, lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Dry dock gig. V-Class shuttle.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: On the sly. Cool and by the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Mess with their heads, pick their pockets. Chop shop’s dark side.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: You really expect Anders to land a V- Class on the dark side? ANDERS. I’d tell you how many times I’ve flown over Darkness if I thought you could count that high. Kellogg laughs at the ball-breaking. Val looks at Mullins

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Want the job?

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: (grins) Got nothing else planned. Val lifts his glass in salute.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Here’s to crime that pays. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all drink up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon’s commuter train. Packed with workers and white collars in a collective day’s-end trance. Val stands a bit drunk among the others as the tram speed along. He stares up through a SKYLIGHT, dreaming alone. HIS POV: Millions of STARS shine sharp and bright in the lunar sky.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: Jarrett’s voice over the black.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Val. Wake up. INT. VAL’S APARTMENT - LCC Views of the Fra Mauro highlands out the window. Pictures sailboats on the walls, a sextant on a shelf. An empty pressure suit hangs on the door like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Answer me, Val. Val bolts upright in bed at the sound of Jarrett’s voice. Touches a sensor that produces a small HOLOGRAPHIC JARRET

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: South Agridome in twenty minutes. Entrance nine.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What’s goin’ on?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Tycho Brae wants to meet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Both of us?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: That’s what he said. Twenty minutes. Jarrett’s holograph disappears. Val gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two thousand acres of farmland under a translucent dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett stand in the middle of an enormous field crops growing in synthetic soil. A solitary, artificial r cloud moves low over the field, watering it a row at a ti Two men approach from across the field. The taller one is TYCHO BRAE, interplanetary boss. Close Jarrett’s age, but more refined and sophisticated. A man complete control of everything and everyone around him.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Jarrett. Val. Brae motions to the other man -- NIGEL, slightly younger, look of pronounced indifference on his face.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Val, this is Nigel. Nigel takes care of business for me when I’m unable to...much the same as Jarrett used to do before our situations changed--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What do you want, Brae? Brae pauses, like he’s refraining from lobbing an insult.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: I want to offer you a job.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You know the deal. we get five hundred to put the suits on, extra five if it’s dry-dock work--

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: This job pays twenty. Million. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett’s stunned. Val doesn’t miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What is it? Brae directs his attention to Val.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Freighter payload.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Class?

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Light Speed. This stops Val for a beat. Jarrett squints.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Is it in dry dock?

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: It’s in a surface hangar?

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Huh-uh. Jarrett looks stumped but Val gets it right away.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (cool) You want us to hit it in-flight. Brae gleams.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You’re kidding...

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Off Mars Coast, while it’s in-bound, at sub-light velocity, of course.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: No he’s not... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Fifteen million credits, plus another five in mining options if you deliver the payload completely intact.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What’s the payload? A beat. Then a smug grin winds across Brae’s face.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: The ship’s the payload, isn’t it? Brae nods at Val, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: BRAE
dialogues.text: This is one sharp apprentice you’ve got, Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You’re out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: I know. I can’t help it. The whole idea makes me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Hijack a Light Speed Freighter?!

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Hijack and steal.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: That’s never been done.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: The entire history of mankind is one continuous refutation of that statement. You should know better... at your age. Jarrett doesn’t react.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forgive me for the ass-kissing, but you’re the best crew for the job. The launch window opens in sixty days, the offer’s good for forty...but I’d prefer not to cut it so close.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You already have our answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brae shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Come on, Jarrett. Take a smoke break. Life’s too short.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Gets a lot shorter if you drop the ball in zero-g. Brae smiles at Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Always loved how you dare to dream... (glances at Val) Forty days, twenty million. Roll those numbers around and call me. Brae turns and leaves. Nigel follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett have the tram to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: We should do this.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Last time I did a big job with Brae I spent the next three years of my life in the Arctic Prison.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: That was ten years ago...you’ve pulled jobs for him since.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Five hundred grand is a job; fifteen million is a whole different thing.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We’re not doing this, Val.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: But we could do this. 12. Jarrett looks at Val, dead serious, cutting him off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Things are good for us right now. We have it down. I’m not pissing it away on some rodeo ride for Brae. The tram stops.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s cold in the Arctic Prison. Jarrett steps off. The tram starts. Val watches him disappear as the tram SPEEDS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim lighting. Hints of movement, something open and sexua going on in the shadows. Val enters and heads for the bar. A bald man with a head of tats, face pierced like a pin-cushion, and a boa constrictor draped over one shoulder puts a drink in fron him. One or two other creepy characters nod to val. It’s obvious he’s a regular. Val lights a cigarette, takes a swig of his drink ADRIENNE, 20s, beautiful, cold as metal, lips like black petals, takes a seat next to him. She runs a hand through hair, gives him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Ready, baby? Val downs his drink. They both get up. INT. ADRIENNE’S ROOM - CESTUS CLUB Val lies back on a large, round cushion, drifting in the sleepy early stages of a blissful intoxication.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Last job took us close, closest I’ve been in a while. Adrienne comes over to him, leans down...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Look up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and squeezes a dropper into one of his eyes. She flood his eyeball with a clear liquid, then does the same to th other. Val blinks. Adrienne moves away.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: The whole thing was right beneath me. I could pick out the Indian Ocean. I could taste the spray. Tasted like my childhood... Adrienne reappears and hands Val a small vial of neon blu liquid. He dabs it onto his tongue and hands it back VAL (CONT’D) I’m going back someday, Adrienne.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You’re going back right now.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: For real. The lights go down. Val looks around. It’s a look of peac VAL (CONT’D) I’m going to sail the ocean. We hear the SOUNDS of the ocean. VAL’S POV: The boundaries of the room have given way to TROPICAL SKIES and swelling OCEAN WAVES, as if Val was ri on a boat through high seas. Adrienne reappears. She is naked, skin shining through a sheen of body oil. She walks to Val over the “water,” lay down next to him, starts to undress him. CLOSE ON VAL’S FACE as he enjoys his hallucination.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna sail the Earth. As Adrienne slowly climbs on top of him, the room looks b and empty as before. Only Val can see the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MAGNIFIED POV: EARTH - the South Pacific Ocean to be prec  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, mostly parents and children, sit around the room comfortable VIEWING STATIONS, looking at their selected telescopic images on thin computer monitors. Val sits alone, staring at his ocean, when a HAND touches arm. He looks up to see Nigel standing above him.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: NIGEL
dialogues.text: To talk.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: NIGEL
dialogues.text: Not me. Val suddenly swoons under a wave of nausea. VAL’S POV: Nigel becomes fuzzy, almost glazed over. He ho up his hand to reveal a small PATCH on his finger. He has drugged Val.

dialogues.speaker: NIGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s take a ride. Val falls into an immediate physical torpor. He’s powerle to resist. He talks like someone shot full of Novocaine.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: VAL’S POV: A BLUR of light...Nigel’s face looking down at out of the blur. A sign reading ‘TRANQUILITY BASE MUSEUM--BLUE LINE’ whizz past Nigel’s shoulder. We’re on the tram.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK OUT
dialogues.text: A long moment passes in the blackness. Then a voice...

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bring him up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VAL’S POV: A soft SPOT of light...sharpening to clarity. Nigel and Tycho Brae looking at us.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry about this, Val. But I just can’t be seen in certain public places on short notice. Pending legal issues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The site of man’s first moon landing has been made into a museum. It’s all there: the LM, a stiff aluminum American flag, Neil and Buzz’s footprints scattered in the dust. One giant leap preserved under a glass dome. Val sits in a front row seat, waking up out of the drug. and Nigel stand in front of him. Val gets his bearings, s up and PUNCHES Nigel in the face. Nigel barely flinches. Grabs his nose and stares blankly Val as blood runs over his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Go wipe yourself. Nigel leaves. Brae offers Val a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Smoke? Val ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Your monkey said you wanted to talk Brae puts the cigarettes away.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: You’ve been working with Jarrett for a while now, haven’t you?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Since right after he finished doing time for you. Brae laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Is that how he tells it? what, that I left him hanging in the wind? That I even set him up, maybe? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: But never that he just choked on the first real opportunity that came his way? Val doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me something, Val. How many real opportunities has Jarrett handed you? Val bites his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: He saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: That’s a start.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Taught me everything I know.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: And I, him. Val doesn’t continue. Brae lets the silence hang.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could take the freighter, couldn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I don’t work alone-- Brae interrupts, pushing the question.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: But one could take the Light Speed Freighter? I mean, you do agree with me that it could be done? Val’s quiet for a second. Then...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: With the right crew, anything’s possible. Brae nods his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: That’s what I like about you, Val. You’re a man of vision. Just like me. You see in...possibilities. Val stares hard at Brae.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Quitting Jarrett to work for you isn’t one of them. Jarrett’s family. I don’t walk away from that. Brae ponders Val for a second, then speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Our entire universe is expanding as we speak. A continuous, never-ending explosion. You and I are pieces of stars, Val. Infinity is now. He pauses one last time, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only a fool tries to go again it. INT. VAL’S APARTMENT Val sits still, lost in thought, staring out the window. VAL’S POV: The EARTH hangs high above the lunar landscape half a blue marble in the deep black sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins steps off the tram and walks with the other passe towards the station exit. Ahead, however, there’s a bottleneck. Mullins and the oth slow down. Something’s going on... Two COPS, dressed in Kevlar suits, their faces hidden beh mirrored riot shields, are escorting a manacled prisoner. It’s ANDERS, the pilot...Busted! A plainclothes DETECTIVE trails behind. As they make thei way through the onlookers... Mullins and Anders lock eyes for an instant. Anders, pale as a dead man, looks scared. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s whisked across the platform into a special TRAM CAR. cops pile in behind him and the car disappears down the t with a WHOOSH. Mullins double-times it out of the station INT. JARRETT’S PLACE - LCC The perennial bachelor’s pad. A digital projection of a F Hals 16th Century Dutch military portrait floats on the w Val, Jarrett and Mullins are present. The mood is grave. A TONE sounds in the room.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Yeah? KELLOGG’S FACE appears in the middle of the portrait.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: (filtered; on monitor) It’s me. Kellogg’s face disappears from the portrait. The door sli open and he enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No good. They took him off-moon two hours ago. Be at least a week before his arraignment. Val turns to Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Then we decide right now. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Where are we gonna get another pilot this quick?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Gifford can hook us up. It’1ll cost us--

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: We’ll take it off the pilot’s end. Everyone looks at Jarrett

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: I need this job, man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett remains stone-faced through a long, heavy silence Then he turns to Val.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Call Gifford and set it up. Jarrett looks at the others.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need this job, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steam-filled labyrinth of ducts and pipes. A loud HISSI over everything. Val and Jarrett stand together, waiting. A FIGURE EMERGES from the steam. A man in a black coat. A he gets closer, we see that his chin and lips are one big recent scar, like someone tried to pry open his mouth wit shovel. This is GIFFORD, interstellar scum-bag.

dialogues.speaker: GIFFORD
dialogues.text: Nice to see you boys slumming again.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (referring to the scars) Didn’t have to get all prettied up just for us.

dialogues.speaker: GIFFORD
dialogues.text: Goddamn Stumper tried to give me a rhinoplasty. Fuckin’ things are swarming my nightmares --

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Where’s our pilot? Gifford’s miffed at Jarrett for interrupting.

dialogues.speaker: GIFFORD
dialogues.text: Making sure you’re not cops. He waves to someone behind him and smiles. GIFFORD (CONT’D) You guys are gonna like Lester. Another figure emerges from the steam. This one is a woman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LESTER RILEY. Tall, young and beautiful. Strong and lithe Deep, piercing eyes. Sex snared in body armor. GIFFORD (CONT’D) Lester, meet the boys. The men are surprised. They obviously weren’t expecting a woman, much less a gorgeous one.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (to Gifford) “Lester?” Lester nails Val with a hard stare.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Never saw a pilot wearing pants you wanted into? Val’s caught out by the attitude...but likes it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Think I was just expecting someone...shorter.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I heard you Earth-system guys were small time, but I thought that was about balls, not brains. Gifford snorts a snot-drenched laugh.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Nothing small here, sister. We’re running a big toy to the dark side.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: If it’s got a stick, I can handle it. Val laughs.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Let me guess, not a cockpit you can’t fit?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Well, if you fly as good as you talk we might have to take you on. She walks right up to him, looks him straight in the eye. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Are you Jarrett? Val grins, cocky, holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I’m Val. She doesn’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Then I’m wasting my time. Val frowns at the put-down. Jarrett steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: I’m Jarrett. Lester turns to him, extends her hand.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Lester Riley. I thought this was a done deal.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Word is you last worked outer system, pulled a big job off Triton Coast with the Gates brothers.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I flew for Billy for six months.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Why’d you leave?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: It was a...language thing.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Well, see, Billy speaks English fine, but he doesn’t understand it too well. I used the word “No” several times one night and maybe it’s just me, or maybe it’s all that reefer Billy smokes, but I had to stab him through the hand so he could hear better. That dissolved our partnership. Jarrett nods, grins. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Language thing.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Poor Billy.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Interview over?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Still want the job?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Long as you understand that while we’re in-flight and I’m at the stick my word goes until engine shutdown. I call the shots while we’re pulling G’s. End of discussion. Val burns. But Jarrett doesn’t flinch.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: No problem there. Long as you understand that if you so much as fantasize about calling shots after engine shutdown, I will put a bullet through your skull without feeling bad. Far as discussion’s concerned I’1l go ahead and shoot you now if you object. Lester gives Jarrett a million dollar grin.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You got yourself a wheel man. Jarrett smiles back. He can’t take his eyes off of her. V notices and doesn’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Then how about we cut short this love- in and go steal ourselves a spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A repair garage floating in space. Long cylindrical tubes connect two enormous docking rings rotating like giant Ferris wheels at each end. Stuck to the rings are a VARIETY OF SPACECRAFT.  24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of rushing air. Then a BUZZER. Inner doors open and the next shift of mechanics and engi pours from the airlock. Among them...MULLINS AND KELLOGG, dressed as maintenance Mullins carries a case. They exit and head to the right. Then, VAL, JARRETT AND LESTER, also dressed maintenance, carrying large duffle bags. They head left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett and Lester blend in with the heavy foot traf They walk fast, without a word. Another corridor breaks off to the right. Val takes it al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins stands watch. Kellogg, wearing dark glasses, punc buttons on a keypad next to the door. CLOSER ON KELLOGG’S GLASSES, as a series of tiny numbers scroll across the inside of his lenses. It’s a micro-HUD, feeding him the entry code. A light flashes on the keypad. Mullins clamps a pair of d glasses over his face and nods at Kellogg. They OPEN the door and step quickly inside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SHUTS. A surprised TECHNICIAN swivels around in seat and starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Hey, what?-- Mullins SWINGS his case into the Technician’s head. He go out cold and Kellogg takes his seat at the console. Mulli tears open his case and pulls out a polymer MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shipping containers stacked to the ceiling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val hunches beneath them and unzips his duffel bag. Inside is his PRESSURE SUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester open up their duffels. Jarrett pulls o his pressure suit, then stops, watching Lester stripping of her maintenance suit to her underwear, all-business. She looks right at him as she peels off her clothes. Jarr follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician lies unconscious on the floor, wrists and ankles cuffed. Kellogg and Mullins wear com headsets.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: (into headset) Everybody on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, fully pressurized in his suit, speaks.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett responds as Lester stands by.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Two and three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg watches codes roll over a monitor in front of him One line stops moving and starts blinking.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Okay. Got it. Serial number Vv, S, nine, seven. Port docking ring, slip twelve. That’s ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett, again.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Fuel status?  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val listens.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Hypergolics, seventy-five percent. Battery, twenty. Cryogenic, zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester nods to Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Bring the house down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val tenses up. He grabs the rungs of a ladder bolted into wall behind him and looks ahead at the cargo bay door.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) You set one? CLOSE ON VAL’S FACE as he breathes in deep.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ golden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg dangles his finger over a button...

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: And out of order came...chaos. ...then presses it. A light begins to FLASH on the monito He touches another and a short ALARM sounds once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cargo bay door BLASTS OPEN. Containers are SUCKED out a rush of escaping atmosphere. Val CLINGS to the ladder, his legs extending straight out watches the last container spiral out of the hold, then h LETS GO and TUMBLES the length of the room--

dialogues.speaker: OUT INTO SPACE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --where he glides behind the ejected containers for just second, before he FIRES HIS BOOT THRUSTERS and zips down length of the space station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand ALARMS go off. A startled CONTROLLER spills hi coffee as he checks his console.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: I’m showing pressure failure in number two cargo bay! His SUPERVISOR springs into action.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Get me visual! The entire bank of monitors GOES DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg wreaks havoc with his keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Blindfold’s on, now we spin ‘em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red lights start to FLASH. More ALARMS scream.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: Fire! Starboard docking tunnel! A- section!

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Seal and flash it! Sound the alarm! An ARMED GUARD bolts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency alarms WAIL. Workers SCRAMBLE for safety. FIREMEN and GUARDS rally. Bulkhead doors SEAL. INT. “A-SECTION” CORRIDORS - SEQUENCE A dense, burst of DRY CHEMICALS engulfs the corridors, extinguishing a non-existent fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg monitors the chaos. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: You there yet, one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val coasts over the port docking ring. A V-CLASS PASSENGER SHUTTLE is parked up ahead in Slip 12 Its silver fuselage glints like a bullet in the sun. Val lands firmly beneath the cockpit windows.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: On the property. He makes his way “Spidey-like” on hands and feet across t surface of the shuttle to the hatch where he kneels “upsi down” and uses a tool to jimmy the handle. The ROTATION of the docking ring brings a small EARTH swi momentarily into view behind him. Val opens the hatch and slides into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark in here. A LIGHT on Val’s helmet comes on. He pushes off and floats to a small console.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I’m inside. Give me the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg takes a cue from his monitor.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Three, seven, five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val keys the sequence into the console.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) ...nine, zero, six. The cockpit starts to blink awake.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: She’s alive.  29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester are ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Two and three coming in. Lester opens the door slightly, but closes it quickly as phalanx of GUARDS hurries past. When the coast clears, Le and Jarrett step out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency lights flashing, alarms still SOUNDING. Jarrett walks straight across to a door marked: Construct Access Lock: Authorized Personnel Only.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Open it. The inner door slides OPEN. Jarrett and Lester step insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inner door CLOSES. Jarrett hooks a tether to Lester. They look at each other for a moment, then tuck their hea

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Blow it. The outer door OPENS. Jarrett and Lester are SWEPT into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester come out of their tumble in the middle the port docking ring. Jarrett FIRES his thrusters and to Lester to the shuttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester climb in.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We're in. Val pulls the hatch SHUT. He LOCKS it. Lester STRAPS hers into the pilot’s seat. She checks the controls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Guidance is up. Tracker’s disabled. Engines are primed. We’re ready to disconnect. Val and Jarrett strap in behind her. Val glances at Jarre

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You bring that bullet? Lester shoots him a look. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg feeds more commands into the console.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Disconnecting...now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoses and pipes BLAST from the fuselage and the shuttle b to DRIFT gently out of the slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val watches Lester.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Stand by for my favorite part... Lester reaches up and grabs two handles.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Full thrust. She pulls the handles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine ports at the back silently EXPLODE. The shuttl ROCKETS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester, Val and Jarrett smash against their seat backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg and Mullins, minus his gun and case, exit the aux control room. Kellogg touches the keypad and nods to Mull They pull off their glasses and walk away from each other  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitors come back on. The controllers look stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: What the hell--?

dialogues.speaker: BOSS
dialogues.text: (eyeing his monitor) Fire’s out. Pressure restored--

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: (checking all his systems) Hold on here...We’re missing a ship. We’re missing a whole goddamn ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive station becomes a shiny dot in the shuttle’s It’s a clean getaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester watches a clock countdown the burn time. She shove the handles back into place.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Thrust out.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Nice job.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: We’re not on the ground yet.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Punch out anytime, Mister--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship rifles towards the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon swells outside the cockpit windows. On the horizon, the line of debarkation from light to DAR SIDE of the moon approaches fast. A heads-up COMPUTER IMAGE of the mountainous lunar landsc comes up on the cockpit window. It shows the ragged moon rushing beneath them at a fantastic rate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks ahead, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the dark side of the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle disappears into the inky night of the dark si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester watches the heads-up imaging on the cockpit window Beyond that...only the deepest black.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Firing descent engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAME leaps from the descent engine nozzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester concentrates on the heads-up image. Val does his b to annoy her.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Seatbacks and tray tables to their upright positions, please. It’s a balmy 200 degrees on the moon. We hope you’ve enjoyed your flight-- Suddenly an ALARM sounds and the heads-up imaging DISAPPE

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Eyes are gone. She tries a series of switches.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Backup’s not responding!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Must be a fail-safe.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: The chop shop’1l shoot us down if we can’t light up at their beacon.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I’m going manual. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester releases the steering console. It pivots up in fro of her and she grabs the stick.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Call it off! Pull out!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: No! Jarrett looks at Val like he can’t believe what he just h

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can make it.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Somebody call out the vectors! Val swivels his seat away from Jarrett to the nav console

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Altitude twenty, velocity ninety- seven hundred --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spacecraft HURTLES down through the darkness. Jets of FIRE spit from the descent engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, again.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Ten down, one-thousand forward...

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We can still ditch it.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Not unless I say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The descent engines burn hotter as the shuttle plunges to shadows of a JAGGED LANDSCAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester, Val, Jarrett strain to see through the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I got visual. Fifteen degrees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett glance forward. Like a single bulb in an ocean of black-- A TINY RED LIGHT appears below and ahead.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hit the lights. A swath of LIGHT shoots out from the shuttle, barely pier the blackness to reveal-- A MOUNTAINOUS CRATER RIM about to kiss the window.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Hang on! Lester swings the stick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast of THRUST and the shuttle VEERS left, missing the mountain top by inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett brace themselves as the shuttle HEAVES.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Lester--

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Let me fly this bitch, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship SWERVES, CRACKS THROUGH LOOSE ROCKS on a hilltop WEAVING through a rugged CANYON as it descends towards th light at the bottom of a GIANT CRATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett hang on as Lester ROLLS the shuttle sidew

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sneaks through a narrow passage into the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester brings the ship level and smooth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Plenty of room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship SLOWS even more. A series of thin LIGHTS erupt from the red beacon on the surface below and paint a CROSSHAIRS over a landing site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A “Fuel Warning” FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You’re on fumes. Lester ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Don’t even need ‘em...contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle TOUCHES down. The red beacon goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester kills switches.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Shutdown. Throws off her belts, turns in her seat to face Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wanna shoot me, boss? She looks pissed as hell. But Jarrett just stares back at her, poker-faced, until he cracks a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think I do. Lester grins. So does val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lunar surface behind the shuttle OPENS UP, revealing RAMP leading down. Three large LUNAR TRUCKS roll up, hook the shuttle and start to tow it underground.  36. INT. “CHOP SHOP” HANGAR - BENEATH THE MOON Two dozen MEN with heavy tools descend upon the shuttle. rappel down from the ceiling, others move in on the groun They are stripping parts from the spacecraft as Val, Jarr and Lester emerge from the hatch, tired. VINCENT, an overweight man in dirty coveralls, approaches

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: All I got is scotch. INT. VINCENT’S OFFICE - CHOP SHOP A dog-eared sofa, some folding chairs and a steel desk. Val, Jarrett, Lester and Vincent drink Johnnie Walker Bla and smoke cigarettes. Thick windows look out on the rapidly disintegrating shut Vincent scrutinizes Lester.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: Triton, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Triton.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It’s a moon, Vincent. Orbits Neptune.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I hear something about a new prison out there, on Triton. Lester looks him straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I try to stay away from prisons. Vincent sits back in his chair

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I don’t travel deep sky much, myself. (sips his scotch) Too easy to get lost.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Got a feeling Lester knows her way around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester smiles at him. Jarrett smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I’d take that tour.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: (re: his remark) You’re about as smooth as you are clean.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: (deadpan serious) Want to make out? Val exhales a ring of smoke, bored with the chit-chat.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: So you can fly shuttles... Lester looks at him. So does Jarrett. VAL (CONT’D) (to Lester) What about big ships?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: How big?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Light Speed Freighter big. Lester stares at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Size does matter.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Val... Val looks over at his boss.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speak to you outside for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett points a finger at Val. Both men have to yell to be heard above the RACKET of the workers stripping the shuttle in the b.g. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: That’s the last I ever want to hear about that job. Far as I’m concerned, it doesn’t exist.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: She could do it. She didn’t even flinch when I mentioned it. And I bet she can handle a thrust suit better than Anders--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Did you hear me, Val? There’s no job. wWe’re not getting in business with Brae. The decision’s been made.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I don’t remember deciding anything.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: That’s because I do the deciding.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You were calling shots from the backseat up there. You broke the rules.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: I made the rules, I can break them. I give the orders, you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: If she’d obeyed your orders up there, we’d be walking back home right now instead of sitting here all liquored up with a full tank in the bank. Jarrett gets ice-cold.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You don’t like it, you can walk.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Maybe I’1l1 do that.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: I’m not offering, Val. I’m telling. Noise of ratchets and air-wrenches reverberates off the h walls. Val gives Jarrett a long, incredulous look. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want the bigger jobs then you go get ‘em. You get your own crew together, go raise some hell.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You’re cutting me loose?! what's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: I’m getting smart, that’s what. I got a nice piece of luck tucked away. Something says I share any more with you, I’m gonna lose the whole stash. Jarrett stares at him, serious as stone.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: That’s it then? Silence. Jarrett gestures to the shuttle...

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You’11 get your cut. ...and walks away, back towards the office. Val watches him rejoin the others, sullen...disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthrise. The shiny blue and white ball creeps up over t lunar horizon. INT. ADRIENNE’S ROOM - CESTUS CLUB Val reclines on the cushion. His usual look of bliss is g though. He’s sweating, as if he’s in pain. There is the SOUND of rough seas. Adrienne leans over him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong, Val?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I don’t...I don’t know. Maybe the dose--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: Shhh. Calm down. I’11 get you something to drink. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and goes away. Val closes his eyes and tries to slow his breathing. Then he opens them again. VAL’S POV: LESTER stands in front of him now, among the o waves of his hallucination.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Lester?? She smiles warmly at him, then leans close. He reaches fo her. They kiss. He strokes her face...but she suddenly disappears. Confused, Val tries to get up.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: wait!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Val? VAL’S POV: ADRIENNE leans back into view, holding a drink She looks at him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Who let her in? Adrienne looks behind her, then back to Val.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: There’s nobody here.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I saw her...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE
dialogues.text: You only see what you want to see in here, honey. You know that. Val stares past her, lost. She puts down the drink.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIENNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you see me, Val? He doesn’t say a word as he gets up and leaves, hurrying.  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling hills pockmarked with a thousand craters, baking the 225 degree Fahrenheit heat of the bright lunar noon. A single LUNAR TRUCK crawls a well-worn path in the dust. Flickering blue laser light patterns dance around its box freight container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep bowl the size of several coliseums. Hunched behind the large boulders lining the rim are...FO MEN in pressure suits. One of them is VAL. Another one is GIFFORD. The other Two are jumpy and anxious, low-rent lunar BIKER types. They w the truck make its way along the trail below. Behind them rests a MOON SCOOTER -- a small open vehicle for short ho Val aims a light-tool down at the truck. It lights up. He swipes it across his glove -- his suit sparkles blue. Val turns to Gifford.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Wait for me to stop it before you make your move. BIKER ONE speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: BIKER ONE
dialogues.text: I don’t care if you are running this show, you mess up out there, you’re on your own, got it? Val just glares through his visor at Biker One. Biker One smirks. He and Biker Two move for the scooter. Val shoots glare at Gifford.

dialogues.speaker: GIFFORD
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. They won’t screw the pooch.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Best for you they don’t. Val tucks the light tool into his suit.

dialogues.speaker: GIFFORD
dialogues.text: Just make sure you shut down those Stumpers, okay, pal? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val stares coldly at Gifford then takes two long bounces the one-sixth Earth gravity and disappears over the rim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val JUMPS straight up. His boot thrusters FIRE. He RIPS across the surface towards the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val slows as he approaches the truck, then passes success through the blue laser alarm. He hovers for a second, then drops gently onto the contai engulfed in a staccato explosion of the blue light. He pulls a tool from his suit and opens up a control pane the back of the truck. After a few seconds of fiddling, t laser light SHUTS OFF. The truck comes to a quick HALT. Val looks forward. The SCOOTER skims up to the truck with Gifford at the sti Biker One and Biker Two leap off and reach the cab of the truck in two quick bounds. Val starts to work his way to the freight door when--

dialogues.speaker: BIKER ONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open up! Val turns and looks as BIKER ONE pastes a small lump of c to the cab’s hatch.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Hey! There is a bright FLASH as the hatch FLIES off the truck The two DRIVERS are sucked out in the escaping atmosphere Their bodies explode in the vacuum and scatter in shreds the surface. Biker One jumps to the top of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s “Murder One,” asshole! Biker One pulls a LASER TORCH from his tool belt.

dialogues.speaker: BIKER ONE
dialogues.text: No. That’s murder one, two, three-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks the torch on. White laser light streams from it tip. HE SLASHES it towards val. Val leaps up and pulls something off his belt... It’s a zero-g modified, double-barrel sawed-off SHOTGUN. He levels it at Biker One and pulls the trigger MUZZLE FLASH erupts and Biker One’s helmet EXPLODES in a frothy spray of blood and brains. The recoil ROCKETS Val backwards across the container. He spots Biker Two going for the laser torch and lets him ha the second shotgun barrel. Biker Two is CUT IN HALF at the waist -- his bisected bod halves spin apart in opposite directions. The laser torch drops to the container and clicks ON. A w hot beam of light begins to BURN through a round case nea cab of the truck. The case bears the universal warning label for RADIATION.

dialogues.speaker: GIFFORD
dialogues.text: The reactor! He casts a quick glance at Val, then-- HOPS BACK ONTO THE SCOOTER and hits the gas. The scooter TAKES OFF, leaving Val behind. Val LEAPS from the container, firing his thrusters at the time and-- SHOOTS ACROSS THE GAP TO THE SCOOTER. Makes the grab onto the back of the flying machine just a Gifford tries to escape. An enormous bright FLASH goes off behind them as the luna truck’s reactor explodes. Val gains his footing. Gifford looks over his shoulder in fear. He PITCHES the scooter in an attempt to shake Val o Val holds on with one hand, pulls his grapple gun with th other, and points it at Gifford.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Don’t have to dream about those Stumpers anymore, Gif. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val FIRES. The grapple TEARS into Gifford’s chest, ruptur his pressure suit. Gifford’s face registers a look of horror...Then EXPLODES OVER THE INSIDE OF HIS HELMET. Val releases the grapple. Gifford TUMBLES off the scooter, and FALLS to the surface We hear the filtered SOUND of Val catching his breath as takes over the controls. The SCOOTER disappears over the horizon with Val at the h INT. VAL’S APARTMENT Val comes inside: dirty and seething. He kicks over a chair, turns and rakes his sailing paraphernalia off a shelf in a burst of rage. INT. SHOWER - VAL’S APARTMENT Val stands under the shower, dazed and exhausted...scared

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pressurized city cooks in the lunar sunlight. INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE VAL’S APARTMENT - LCC Val walks along. A VOICE stops him in his tracks...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mister Dalton. Val turns to see a DETECTIVE, flanked by a couple of face cops in riot suits, step from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: If it isn’t the “Too Much Fun Club.”

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: How’s the “construction business?”

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Booming.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: You know the drill. Val raises his hands and faces the wall. One of the cops frisks him while the other runs a SCANNER over his body. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What’s the occasion, Detective?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Couldn’t sleep last night. Two dead truckers kept showing up in my dreams, trying to tell me something. One Cop takes Val’s palmtop and begins DOWNLOADING it int own. The Detective sticks his face next to Val’s. DETECTIVE (CONT’D) I’m glad that scumbag Gifford is dead. Wish I could have shot him myself. But the problem is, he and his buddies took two innocent hardworking family men with them. And I get paid to protect the innocent.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Sounds like a dead-end job to me. The Cop finishes the download. CoP He’s clean, sir. The Detective stares hard at Val for a second more.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured. We’re looking for some real amateur types. Bottom dwellers. Not like you at all, val. The Detective hands Val’s palmtop back. DETECTIVE (CONT’D) See you soon, maybe. He leads the two cops away. Val watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite a clean, well-lighted place. Val, several days unshaven and exhausted, sits alone at t bar. He smokes a cigarette and drinks from a beer bottle. Two empty ones sit in front of him. He looks at a rough-looking group of men and women gather around a large table in the middle of the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon a grid on the table, small G.I. Joe-sized FIGURES in uniform huddle on either side of a leather ball -- it’s a digital broadcast of a FOOTBALL GAME in HOLOGRAPHIC FORM. The scoreboard blinks: LIVE FROM TEXAS TERRITORY - EARTH. RAIDERS 20, COWBOYS 21. It’s 4th and 15 with only seconds left. The “Raiders” bre from the huddle and move to the line of scrimmage.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Come on... The ball is snapped. The quarterback fades, looks for a receiver, scrambles, gets slammed by charging “Cowboys.” CHEERS go up from the group at the table. The BARTENDER glances at Val.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: That’s another hundred you owe me. Val crumples his empty cigarette pack, ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Give me a new pack of sticks. The Bartender tosses Val a fresh pack of cigarettes. Val starts to unwrap it when... WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Mind if I bum one? He turns around to see-- LESTER standing directly behind him. She flashes a smile that could split an atom. Val’s riveted.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Or do I have to wrestle you for it? Val comes out of his trance, hands her a cigarette...

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks. ... lights it for her.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Lester blows a sharp stream of smoke, glances around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Selling Girl Scout cookies.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I mean here, on the moon.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You don’t know? Val shakes his head. Lester lowers her voice.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your boy Anders the pilot got sent up. They stuck him in the Ice House. He’s not coming back anytime soon. Val hesitates before he asks...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Then you’re still working for Jarrett?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Some. (pauses) What about you? Val doesn’t answer. He takes his last swig of beer, then the empty bottle down on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Buy you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You live close?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Buy me one there. INT. VAL’S APARTMENT Val pours two whiskeys. He hands one to Lester, who sits chair near the window, then takes a seat across from her They watch each other, guarded, as they sip their drinks. Finally, Lester nods at the sailboat pictures on the wall

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You sail? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val doesn’t break his gaze, takes a moment to answer.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Want to.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Get to Earth much?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I’m planning on it. Lester nods, grins.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: A man with plans.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I was born down there. My father’s buried there. Buried at sea. He was a sailor before the war.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You want to be buried down there too?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Not anytime soon.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I want to be cremated when I go. Light up like a star. I want ‘em to smell me burning. She takes another sip of her drink, smiles. LESTER (CONT’D) I’ve got plans of my own. Val raises his glass to Lester.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Here’s to the future. He drinks without taking his eyes off Lester

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Find a pilot for your Light Speed Freighter yet?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Ask Jarrett about the job. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: He doesn’t answer. Just like he doesn’t talk about your exit. Val doesn’t blink, smirks back at her

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It was time for me to move on. Take control of my own...destiny.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: How’s that goin’? Val doesn’t say a word, finishes his drink Lester leans forward, serpent-like.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me about the Freighter. Val pauses.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Name “Tycho Brae” ring bells?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Sure. Gates brothers used to talk about him. Made him out to be bigger than big time. Billy was pretty jealous.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Brae does that to people. Jarrett and Brae had history together, but Brae got to write it. Now he wants us to steal a freighter for him, but Jarrett’s not biting.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Have you listened to Jarrett lately? His age is starting to show when he opens his mouth. A long pause. Val moves closer to her. She touches his le

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: A lot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: It pays?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: “King of the Nighttime World” wealth. There is a long heavy pause as they stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Can we get out of these clothes now? INT. BEDROOM - VAL’S APARTMENT Val and Lester have the kind of sex you want to be in on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val sits in the dark. He watches Lester get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: If you get a crew together to take the freighter, I want in. Val shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Takes a certain kind of crew to do something like that. Five or six guys who work together like a clock, where each man knows exactly what the guy next to him can do, what he’s gonna do... CLOSER ON VAL as he pauses, his own words hitting home. VAL (CONT’D) ‘Cause when you’ve got that dialed in, that’s when you can do no wrong and you will not fail. CLOSER STILL as Val stares at her with electric eyes. VAL (CONT’D) I only know one crew like that. Heavy silence.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Would you come back?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It’s not up to me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You didn’t answer the question. Val’s quiet. He looks at Lester, shimmering in the lunar light from the window.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Are you gonna be there?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Answer the question. Val stares at her, takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Then I’1l see what I can do. Lester leans in and kisses him, long, like a lover. Then turns and leaves. Val watches her go, silent. INT. VAL’S APARTMENT - ANOTHER DAY Val enters, carrying groceries.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Messages. Several “phone numbers” are BEAMED onto his wall. Val gla up at one. JARRETT’S HOLOGRAM message appears. JARRETT’S FACE Val. Let’s talk. My place, ten o'clock. INT. JARRETT’S PLACE Jarrett stands shirtless, towelling off wet hair in the m of his living room, just out of the shower.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Open. The door slides open and Val enters. He is clean-shaven dressed in fresh clothes. The two men stare across the ro at each other for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're early. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I got places to be--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Busy?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Got a few things going. Jarrett looks him straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: That’s not what Gifford tells me. Val’s nailed. He can’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ready to listen up? Van nods, silent.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got a tip from Ray: A Rotor Shuttle is going to leave Earth atmosphere on a trans-polar flight. Part of its cargo is a vault of experimental pharmaceuticals. There are five ampoules in that vault for which a buyer has already committed to pay four million dollars

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What’s the security?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: One guy, no alarms. Val looks puzzled. Jarrett explains.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ray has a man Earthside who schedules the payloads. He’s gonna make a mistake that day, put the wrong one on the right ship. Val waits for Jarrett to continue, but Jarrett doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You asking me back in?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You ask back in, I’1l let you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: All those Krugerrands behind a Rent-a- Cop? wWhat’s not to ask? Jarrett steps forward and offers his hand. Val takes it. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You were in whether you asked or not. Val starts, turns towards the voice, sees -- LESTER standing near the bedroom door, leaning against th wall wearing only a thin robe. Her hair, like Jarrett’s, also wet. She’s obviously just been showering with him. V tries not to look surprised...or jealous.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We couldn’t just let you walk out of here if you weren’t in on it. Val follows Lester with blank eyes as she comes into the

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Jarrett’s sentimental, there’s no way he’d let me shoot you. Jarrett smiles, genuine.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Lester’s with us, Val. Val forces his mouth to move, keeping his eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I heard about Anders.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Anders was a good pilot. He looks at Lester like he can’t wait to finish that show JARRETT (CONT’D) Now we got a better one. Jarrett goes to Lester and KISSES HER...intimately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping his face zipped tight, betraying nothing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester meets his eyes as Jarrett breaks off the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Jarrett said he wouldn’t even do this job unless you came back. I’m glad you did. I think we all work well together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has turned to stone. Words barely escape him...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The off-moon transportation depot for smaller commercial spacecraft. Crews bustle to and fro. Others relax in an enormous lobby. Val walks swiftly through the busy port carrying his duff He enters a door marked: PAD 39A-W.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-CLASS HAULER sits ready for takeoff. Kellogg and Mullins make last-minute checks on the ship. There is an awkward pause as Val enters the pad, then Mul offers his hand. Val takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Good to see you back, Val. Kellogg steps forward. He and Val shake.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Missed you, man. Val glimpses Lester through the hauler’s cockpit window.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Jarrett?

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: On his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester runs her pre-flight checks. She turns around to fi (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val standing right behind her in the cockpit hatchway. He stares her down and speaks in a low, urgent tone.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Surprise me again, I’1ll kill you. Lester stares back for a beat, cold, indifferent.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with you? You wanted back in, you’re in. You wanted some real action, you got it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: If Jarrett knew about us--

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You want to tell him? Silence. Val bites his lip. Lester moves close...intimate

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen up. I know what I’m doing. And I’m not doing it for Jarrett. A long look, then she walks away. Val watches her, torn.

dialogues.speaker: NO SOUND. A BRIGHT FLASH...
dialogues.text: and the hauler SHOOTS up through the open hangar ceiling. Zero to Mach 1 in half an eye blink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket ports BURN. The Hauler accelerates out of luna orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-game tension fills the tight corridor as Val, Jarrett Lester and Mullins slip into their pressure suits. Val gives Lester a tough look as he zips in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship drifts above the Earth, a small black spot again Magnificent spherical swirl of blue and white.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett and Mullins sit tight in their pressure suit Lester pilots them towards the target.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: There it is. Through the window, arcing slowly towards them, is a--

dialogues.speaker: ROTOR CRAFT SHUTTLE
dialogues.text: A huge missile-shaped space helicopter, its large rotor b attached to its mid section.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Lights out. The cockpit lights dim.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Starting the roll. Lester ROLLS the hauler to the right, setting it into a s constant spin.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Send the signal. Kellogg works his console.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Mayday, Mayday. This is com hauler “Alecto” calling rotor craft. Please respond. Val watches the rotor craft SPIN around out the window.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Message received, “Alecto.” Please advise.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: We’ve lost core pressure, have two injured crew, request permission to Eva on board.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Permission granted. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on over, “Alecto.” We’1l light up the aft airlock for you. A string of small lights BLINK around a door at the back the rotor craft. Jarrett looks to Val and Mullins. They both nod “ready.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hauler looks dark and dead in its slow spin. Val, Jarrett, Lester and Mullins emerge from the airlock

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Masks up. Their visors BLACK OVER, obscuring their faces. Mullins and Lester play “dead.” Val and Jarrett tow them towards the rotor craft, floating a hundred yards away.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUR OF THEM
dialogues.text: They glide through space towards the giant rotor ship’s airlock doors, bathed in the blue glow of the Earth below

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outer airlock door slides open. Val, Jarrett, Lester Mullins float inside. The outer door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett hold a limp Lester and Mullins as the air pressurizes with a loud HISS. Three MEDICS look at them through an inner window.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We got two injured here! The HISSING stops. The inner doors open. The three Medics rush inside. Mullins, Val and Jarrett pull GUNS. The Medics freeze.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Guess again.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Lester and Mullins storm onto the bridge. T shove the Medics onto the floor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: All right, people. Kiss the floor and button up. I shoot if I see the whites of your eyes. The CREW OF SEVEN stare at the intruders in a complete st of shock. They don’t budge. Mullins steps forward and THWACKS the nearest CREW MEMBER the collar bone with the butt of his machine gun. The Cre Member CRIES OUT in pain as he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re not kidding, folks. This is a robbery. The rest of the crew dive to the floor. LESTER takes the helm, throws switches: Guidance, Nav, Security, Propulsion. A series of DISABLED lights come on. Lester nods to Val. Val steps up to the CAPTAIN, lying on floor with the others, sticks a gun to the back of his he

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Vault key. The Captain hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: I--
dialogues.text: Val FIRES a shot into the floor next to the Captain’s ear

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Vault. Key. The deafened Captain reaches into a pocket and produces a KEY. Val takes it and heads off the bridge with Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Val leads Jarrett through the ship at a run.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Left. They turn a corner. Val and Jarrett lift their guns...

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a corner and come face-to-face with a lone SEC GUARD aiming a revolver at them. It’s a stand-off: Val an Jarrett, menacing in their pressure suits and blacked-out visors, pointing their machine guns; the young guard in h flight suit, gun hand shaking like a leaf. Val simply reaches out and takes the gun away.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Please don’t kill me.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t think of it. Sit down and be quiet. The guard hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: VAULT ROOM
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett enter. Val goes to the vault and opens it with the key card. Inside are racks filled with cases. Jarrett COUNTS three racks across and pulls out that case Opens it. Inside are five vials of deep blue liquid.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What’s five times one?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Four. Million. Dollars. Val grins as Jarrett shuts the case and stuffs it in his bag. He and Val exit the vault room.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Jarrett shoots them a "thumbs up" as he and Val race back the bridge. Lester slips out of the helm and follows them the air-lock. Mullins says farewell to his hostages...

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, you've been a great audience, but sit tight because we're going to blow your air lock in about ten seconds and don't want anyone expanding before their very own eyes. Mullins slips off the bridge. The door slides SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Mullins and Lester climb into a cramped emergency airlock. They close the inner door.  60.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: That was too easy. I almost feel guilty. The others laugh, except Val. He looks at Lester

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What about you Lester? How do you feel? Lester looks straight at Val. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I’m not the guilty type. Jarrett grabs a large HANDLE. Val, Lester and Mullins BRA themselves. Jarrett PULLS. The OUTER DOORS OPEN and they are SUCKED into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight reflects off the expansive glass and steel oasis covering the desolate lunar dust

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What do you mean it’s worthless?

dialogues.speaker: INT. JARRETT'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Jarrett, Lester, Mullins and Kellogg stand. Val sits cool in the corner. Everyone’s glaring at the stolen vials of liquid on the table. Nobody's happy.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Ray’s guy screwed up, loaded the vault in the wrong order. The real stuff never left Earth.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: And we brought our dicks home.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: What about this guy, this screw-up?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Cops took him away.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Singing type? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Don't know.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What does Ray think?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Ray's incommunicado. Cops shook him down last night.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: That means they’1l come for us next. Mullins swings his arm and SMASHES the vials off the tabl

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Well that just makes my week! Nervous silence fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: So what does this mean?

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Means we don't get rich-- Lester cuts him off...nervous.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Besides the money-- I'm talking about us, this crew. More silence.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We shut it down for a while, lay low--

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: I can't really afford to lay low just right now-- Jarrett explodes, angry.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, the situation is what it is. We do not have the advantage this time. If you can’t handle it, then maybe we all just oughta walk five ways and never come back. Jarrett cuts himself off, self-conscious of his outburst. This others look at him, surprised. It’s the first time they’ve ever seen him lose his cool - a chink in the armo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Lester exchange a look. And in that half glance, watches Lester’s lips make a slight, subtle curl at the e of her mouth...a smile. A single smile for Val’s eyes onl smile that says, “here’s your chance.” He takes it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: There is another option. Everybody looks at Val.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can pull one more job. Jarrett nails Val with a hard glare. Val doesn't waver.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's big and it's bad, but we ace it we’1l never have to pull another one. There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: With the heat turned up?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I don't hear anyone knocking yet Silence. Val has their attention.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: How big?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Twenty million.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Jesus...what is it? Before Val can answer--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: It’s a Light Speed Freighter.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Holy...

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: What is...is it a hijack?-- They all fall silent...stunned. Val stands up, looks at t (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: This is how it’s gonna be. We decide first, then we can talk about it. ‘Cause this one's do or die. If this one punches back, we all bleed. Val looks Jarrett in the bull's-eye.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So we decide first. Right now. It gets real, real quiet.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I'm in. Val looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Me too. Val nods, turns to Kellogg.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Yeah. All eyes now go to Jarrett. He looks at Val, expressionle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Littered with broken-down tram cars and machine parts. A LIGHT flickers inside one car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Jarrett stand in the middle of the car. TYCHO BRAE sits in the one remaining intact seat. He look hollow and alert. Jumpy. Like a man who hasn't slept. Nigel stands next to him. A small lantern hanging above t swings pendulums of light across their faces.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Flat refusal, followed by a lengthy reconsideration, capped with eager acceptance in the nick of time...is that Wagner I hear in the background?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We want half up front. Brae is silent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Of course you do. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. Seven point five million will be in your account as soon as you pass Lowell Station... Brae stops. Jarrett is shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Ten million. Half of the whole twenty.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: The "whole twenty" is contingent upon delivery--

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Ten million or no deal. We didn't come here for a good laugh. Brae seems pleasantly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Val's running the show now?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We all know damn well who's running the show here, Brae, so if you want your ship, you make the deal. Brae levels his icy gaze at Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: I trust your new pilot -- what's her name, Louis? -- can handle this. Jarrett burns.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: She can handle a lot.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
