dialogues.text: I imagine so. Brae turns to Val, earnest. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me, is it just Jarrett who fucks her, or does the whole crew get to take a dip? Jarrett LUNGES for Brae. But Nigel has a GUN in his face before he can get there. Val holds Jarrett back with one while he DRAWS his Colt .45 on Brae. Brae remains still.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever...Ten million as soon as you pass the coastal checkpoint. The balance upon delivery. Agreed? Jarrett stands down.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Agreed. No one moves though. The guns stay pointed.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: I've got to wrap up some legal issues offshore. We won’t speak again until after the rendezvous. Nigel will handle logistics for the launch. Since we're down to the wire, I'll donate one of my Lightrail's for the hop. The clock starts now. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: No. Lower your weapon. Val looks at Nigel.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Junior goes first. Nigel steams. Brae looks at him. Nigel reluctantly obeys lowers his gun. Next, Val. Jarrett stares hard at Brae.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: After this job’s done, next time you better pray you see me first.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Val turn to leave.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good hunting, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Lester stand frozen in their tracks, gazing admirably at something in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Always wanted to steal one of these. THEIR POV: THE AZON LIGHTRAIL, a razor-sleek spaceship wi polished titanium hull, poised for launch. Markings on th tail proclaim, “Pectel Mining Corp.” Thin wisps of vapor around supercooled propellant hoses snaking from its underbelly. It looks fast as light.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Seven minutes to Mars.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Too bad we have to scuttle it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I don't know...seven minutes? That's enough time to find a buyer, don't you think, Nigel? Nigel's not amused by Val’s joke. Jarrett walks ahead wit him, leaving Val and Lester alone for a moment VAL (CONT’D) (low voice) That was slick what you pulled with the rotor shuttle gig. Very slick.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Come on, you didn’t bring me back in just for four mil in dope. You set the whole thing up to back Jarrett into this job. It was a phony heist. She looks at him, then steps close enough to kiss him.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: We got what we wanted, right? Val just stares into her eyes, then-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling her) Lester... Lester purses her lips at Val and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bathyscaph-like DOCKING POD is secured in the hol Val and Mullins prep gear while Kellogg works on a pressu suit with a meticulous hand. The suit sparkles alternatel blue, green, yellow as he checks its laser evasion system

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Why worry about those alarms when we got these? Mullins lifts the "mother of all MACHINE GUNS" out of a b shoulders it.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Remington Z-16. Freon-cooled pulse plasma; fires thirty rounds a second fully auto - this baby's a Stumper party dream date.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: The kid's in love. Mullins slews the gun around and draws a bead on Kellogg.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Works pretty good on people, too. Kellogg gives him "the finger." Val notices the round TUBE fitted to Mullins's gun.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Grenade launcher?

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I tweaked it to take a standard fission charge. Mullins holds up something resembling a hockey puck.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (demonstrating) Set the timer, load, pull, send your neighbor a supernova. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looking at something down the corridor. VAL'S POV: LESTER moves around in the cockpit, adjusting instruments, setting controls. She becomes aware of Val's gaze, and looks back at him for a moment. Val turns back to the others.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s get this done.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JARRETT'S PLACE
dialogues.text: It's the final briefing. Val, Lester, Jarrett, Mullins Kellogg. A HOLOGRAPHIC MODEL of a Light Speed Freighter ( hovers in front of them. Even in miniature it looks enorm

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: The LSF’s awareness systems are too sophisticated for us to even attempt a straight ship-borne assault. So we’re going to play hop-scotch-- Val waves his hand, producing another HOLOGRAM model, thi of a MASS DRIVER - an unmanned spaceship consisting of a latticed frame pushing an asteroid through space. VAL (CONT’D) This mass driver will be flying a course that will intersect the freighter’s at precisely 0100 hours. A path of light inside the hologram highlights what Val s

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’11 land the docking pod onto the mass driver, hitch a ride to the point of intersection, then bail off and drop onto the freighter as it passes underneath us... It looks impossible. The others watch, gravely serious. VAL (CONT’D) Once we commit to the docking pod, it’s a one-way ticket, no return. We get one chance to board the freighter; we miss, it’s over.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: All over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Team one will land here-- Jarrett touches the hologram -- a circle is HIGHLIGHTED.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Disable optic transmission and drop to the Com Mainframe where you will shut down all ship-to-shore talk long-range tracking, anything and everything unfriendly to our cause. Jarrett touches the model again -- another circle lights near the front of the LSF.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lester and I enter here and move strong for the bridge. Val looks through the hologram at Lester, furtive. She catches his eye then looks away. A circle lights up on one side of the LSF...

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll flush the prisoners out in the starboard escape shuttle-- ...then another lights up on the opposite side.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Save the port shuttle for our departure after we hand off the ship to Brae. Several smaller circles light up throughout the ship including ONE CIRCLE in the ENGINE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Remember, the green lifeboats are non- maneuverable while the ship's in the inner system. If things go south and you are forced to punch out in one of these, be advised you have no control whatsoever over your destination, if you reach it.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: That's a long deep hypersleep. The hologram disappears. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Any questions? Lester raises her hand. The others look. Val nods

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do with all that money? She smiles big. Everyone else does, too. Except Val.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glasses are filled with bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: INT. JARRETT'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Lester, Mullins and Kellogg stand under the giant Frans Hals military portrait, their glasses raised. Lester looks right at val.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Here’s to the future. They all CLICK their glasses together and down their shot

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JARRETT'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Mullins and Kellogg exit and go their separate ways down hall. Val steps through next, Lester right on his heel. S turns to Jarrett, standing next to her

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I have to run the post-fueling check. Jarrett looks at Val walking away.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Val... Val stops, turns around a faces Jarrett

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go with her. Val catches Lester's eye for just a second, nods, follows  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long tunnel of red light. Val and Lester walk quickly d it. Lester glances over her shoulder at Val. Windows now appear on the sides of the gangway. Through t we can see the Lightrail resting on the pad under a now O CEILING. Lester reaches the hatch and opens it. They both enter the spaceship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swollen Earth appears in the distance through the cockp window, a glowing blue globe born from infinite darkness. Lester enters the cockpit first. She turns around to face as he follows her in. They move to each other at the same time. Lips press together as their bodies meet. Clothes c off fast. Lester scoots up on one of the command couches pulls Val into her. They make love.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTRAIL COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Val and Lester lay still and naked on the command couch, glistening on their skin. They look out the window at the Earth, looming larger than ever over the lunar landscape.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: You're going there after the job, aren't you? You're going back to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: One way, non-stop.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I’ve never been. Her words hang thick and heavy in silence for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jarrett thinks the whole place is a prison. He'll never go back (a beat) I’d love to see it though-- Val turns, looks deep and hard into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I was seventeen, working a straight paycheck gig welding beams on station frames. Jarrett was my foreman. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One day, my thruster pack stuck. Spun me a half-klik off the platform, out of control. I was about to be torn apart inside my suit when Jarrett came out of nowhere and hit the kill switch. Next day we both quit, went to work for ourselves. See, Jarrett saved me twice - the first time when he hit that kill switch; the second, when he took me outta that goin' nowhere good-guy ride and taught me the straight and narrow life of crime. Val just looks at her, then gets up and grabs his clothes VAL (CONT’D) You want to come with me, you can. But nothing happens to Jarrett. I owe him my life, he gets to keep his. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: A FLASH OF LIGHT.
dialogues.text: The Lightrail lifts off the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rocket ports on the back of the Merlin FIRE to life, propelling the spacecraft out of lunar orbit.

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester sit side by side.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Prepare to jump. Their flight couches SEAL around their bodies. A loud WHIRRING noise fills the ship. Jarrett and Lester pinch their noses to equalize pressure

dialogues.speaker: CREW DECK
dialogues.text: Val, Mullins and Kellogg are SEALED into their couches. Kellogg yells over the loud NOISE... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: I don't care how short the trip is, I hate lightspeed jumps. I still wish I could sleep through it.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: You can if you black out.

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Lester grabs the joystick.

dialogues.speaker: CLASSIC AIR-JOCKEY VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Seven five nine, corridor is open corridor is yours.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Copy, control. Fusion prop on my mark. Three, two, one, mark--

dialogues.speaker: CREW DECK
dialogues.text: Val relaxes. Kellogg tenses up and shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: And then there was light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the ship glows like a small sun... And then it's GONE.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTRAIL COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Streams of light ripple over Jarrett and Lester's visors growing brighter as the ship accelerates, until-- FLASH! White hot light blows out the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: (filtered) Speed!

dialogues.speaker: CREW DECK
dialogues.text: Val and Mullins smile as they watch the streaks of light over their heads. Kellogg shuts his eyes tighter Val's eyes start to roll back...he fights it then BLACKS  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin STREAK of color splits the blackness like a rainbo shot from a cannon. It leaves behind nothing but stars and silence.

dialogues.speaker: VAL'S EYELIDS
dialogues.text: Closed.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wake up, dog. We’re outta the black. They blink open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val comes to. Mullins stands over him, grinning, and adds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks like a wreck. Kellogg hands him a cup of coffee while Mullins looks on. Val takes a sip and grimaces as Jarrett and Lester step into the galley.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You okay? Val rubs his head.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Never had it this bad before.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Must be getting old.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Lowell Station's got us in a holding pattern. Some kind of prisoner transfer going on. They've sealed the whole area.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No big deal. We'll be outta here in three hours. Plenty of time. Lester nods her head at Val's cup. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Put some sugar in it. Lester and Jarrett exit. Val watches them go as Kellogg passes him some sugar. Val shakes his head, declining, then dumps the rest of th coffee altogether and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: CREW DECK
dialogues.text: Val is alone on the deck, checking out his pressure suit. Jarrett enters, then speaks in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We got the money. Val nods.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I moved it to the dummy account.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Lester? Jarrett shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You're still the only one besides me who has the code. Nobody else. Val looks at Jarrett, almost surprised. Jarrett turns to leave. Val hesitates over something, then speaks...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Jarrett... Jarrett quickly turns around, almost expecting it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to talk--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Save it. Jarrett looks at him, forgiving. Val stays quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHTRAIL drifts high above the red planet MARS, in synchronous orbit with an immense orbital structure -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOWELL STATION, the "gateway" to deep space. Clusters of spacecraft drift in a loose line behind and i front of the Lightrail, each waiting their turn to procee into the asteroid belt.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Seven, five, niner, leared to proceed. The Lightrail moves smoothly away from Lowell Station.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) We copy. Thanks guys. The rocket ports FLARE then quickly CUT OUT as the ship l Mars space and heads into the-- ASTEROID BELT, barely visible up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester scans the HUD RADAR image on the cockpit window th shows the positions of various ASTEROIDS, swirling throug space like stones in a dryer. Jarrett glances over her shoulder at the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Busy out here today. Lester points out the window.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I got the mass driver. Jarrett looks.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: There's our ride.

dialogues.speaker: CARGO HOLD
dialogues.text: Val looks out a small porthole. The MASS DRIVER, pushing its ASTEROID payload through spa 20,000 miles per hour, flies relative a thousand yards ou Those thousand yards between the Lightrail and the Mass D are full of many more thousands of small asteroids and ro SPIRALING through space - an interplanetary hail storm.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Lester, Mullins and Kellogg are packed into docking pod, all wearing pressure suits. Lester takes the controls. The cargo bay door OPENS. OUTSIDE the Mass Driver cruises directly below the Merlin

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: (nervous) This is that point-of-no-return, do- or-die time, right?

dialogues.speaker: MULLING
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: I hate those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The docking pod MOVES forward on a track until it extends of the Lightrail into space. It JOLTS to a stop then-- FALLS AWAY from the mother ship. It rights itself with a few bursts of fine thrust, then S towards the Mass Driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester steers past the whizzing asteroids.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: We are down among ‘em, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod descends FAST towards the Mass Driver. Short burs PUFF from its fine thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIRP sounds.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Collision alarm.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about this small stuff-- Jarrett sees it a half-second before the others do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: This isn't small! THEIR POV: An ENORMOUS ASTEROID tumbles out of nowhere, straight for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thrust POUNDS from every nozzle. The pod DARTS to its rig then SPINS around-- JUST AS THE ASTEROID tumbles past, disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester stabilizes the pod as everybody catches their brea

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (to Lester) Did you blow your fuel?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: We're gonna find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod THRUSTS towards a DOCKING PORT on the spine of th long, unmanned ship. The small thrusters throw all their power into it as the pod strains forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: We're losing relative speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny pod just can't get closer to the docking port. Then the ENGINES CUT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Fuel's gone! Damnit! Val goes for the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (to Mullins) Move! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Mullins away as he pulls a TETHER out of his su and hooks it to the inside of the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blowing the hatch!

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: What’s that gonna do?!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Kill you if you don’t clip in!! The others hurry to CLIP themselves in as Val pulls the h release. The hatch BLASTS OPEN into the vacuum of space. Val is sucked out of the pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val flies through the hatch, connected to it by the tethe He aims his body forward and -- FIRES HIS THRUSTERS. Sails past the leading edge of the pod. DRAWS HIS GRAPPLE GUN. FIRES at the docking port. The grapple HOOKS the docking ring. Val hits his THRUSTERS and-- PULLS THE POD INTO THE MASS DRIVER’S DOCKING PORT. The pod's nose CLICKS home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod clings to the Mass Driver like a bug. Val’s a spe he moves back to the open hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val comes back inside, pulls the hatch shut behind him. He looks at the others. They are all still in shock, stun at how close they came to death, awed by Val’s efforts. It’s a long beat before...

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: You rock. Val looks at Lester. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (catching his breath) Let’s get on with it. DOCKING POD POV - LOOKING UP: The Lightrail closes its ca door as it PITCHES down, then YAWS around until its nose pointed away from our direction of travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Kellogg, Mullins watch Lester maneuver the via REMOTE CONTROL.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Firing engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lightrails rocket ports IGNITE and the ship TEARS awa from the mass driver, going out of sight almost immediate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett watches a clock tick down on his HUD.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Detonation. Outside a small FLASH OF LIGHT appears in the distance. N bigger than a shooting star. Val, Jarrett, Lester, Mullins and Kellogg stare into spac

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The docking pod holds to the Mass Driver like a remora as huge, silent craft speeds along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody sits cramped against the walls, waiting. Val st at Lester like he wishes they were alone.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: How much time left?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Four hours, forty. Mullins squirms in his suit, rubs his boot across the flo (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: My foot itches.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: They can put a man on the moon, but they can’t make a decent sock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mass Driver tows the pod on through the belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire crew is on their feet, watching out the window Weapons and tools assembled, ready to rock

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Damn. That’s big. In the distance, approaching slowly, is an gigantic shape It's a LIGHT SPEED FREIGHTER. The Empire State Building o spacecraft. Massive and formidable as a castle. Val puts his eyes to the pod's TELESCOPE VIEWFINDER. SCOPE POV: Big black letters spell the name “ANTENORA" ac the bow of the Light Speed Freighter.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's our package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mass Driver starts to pass directly over the gigantic ANTENORA cutting along two thousand feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val, Jarrett, Lester, Kellogg and Mullins, armed with Z-1 and utility packs, CLUTCH ONTO THE OUTSIDE OF THE POD lik stick of skydivers preparing to jump. THEIR POV: The ANTENORA glides up below, like the Titanic rising from the deep.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: Nice knowing you all... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val gives Mullins and Kellogg a "thumbs up" then looks at Jarrett and Lester.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: See you on the bridge. Jarrett nods. VAL PUSHES OFF and FIRES his thrusters. He hurtles headlong through space for the ANTENORA. MULLINS and KELLOGG follow right on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE TINY SPECS -- Val, Mullins and Kellogg -- glide fas towards the giant spacecraft below them. TwO MORE TINY SPECS -- Jarrett and Lester -- drop off the Driver seconds later and head for the ship's bow.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: VAL LEADS MULLINS AND KELLOGG as the Mass Driver pulls aw VAL'S POV: The ANTENORA completely fills our field of vis as the HUD rapidly clicks off the distance to target. Directly ahead is a large OPTIC ANTENNA DISH. A small HAT is visible twenty yards from the dish. Red laser alarms FLICKER around both antenna and hatch, spreading out in P over the entire deck of the ship. He looks to his right and spots-- JARRETT AND LESTER a half-mile away over the front of the Freighter. Val draws his light-tool. MULLINS AND KELLOGG watch Val focus it on the ship as it larger by the second. VAL waves the light-tool all across the deck, then breaks radio silence.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It's not activating.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT AND LESTER
dialogues.text: Dropping towards a forward hatch. Jarrett patiently aims light-tool as they skim towards the deck.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Just hold it...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Moments away from touchdown on the top of the Freighter.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Negative action!

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: still aiming. Keeping calm.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Hold it, Val...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Only feet from the deck...he CATCHES THE LIGHT. He SWIPES tool across his glove. His suit LIGHTS red just as-- HE LANDS ON TOP OF THE FREIGHTER. He spins and flashes the tool at Mullins and Kellogg, fly down right behind him. They catch the beam with their glo Their suits activate as they TOUCH DOWN next to Val. Val, Mullins and Kellogg stand knee-deep in pools of red staccato laser light on top of the mighty ship. They look at each other like they want to pinch themselve

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Touchdown.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT AND LESTER
dialogues.text: lit up red, landing on the front of the ship. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: He hooks himself to the deck and breaks into the cable bo the base of the optic antenna dish.

dialogues.speaker: VAL AND MULLINS
dialogues.text: Twenty yards away, they go to work on the nearby HATCH breaking into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: He clips a device to the base of the optic dish. The devi LIGHTS UP.

dialogues.speaker: VAL AND MULLINS
dialogues.text: Val sees Kellogg wave to them from the dish.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Dish is down. We're going in. Mullins reaches down and turns the MANUAL CRANK on the ha The hatch releases. Mullins pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester break into a hatch marked: RESCUE ACCE

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Right behind you. Lester opens the rescue hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val crawls into --  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val floats down the tunnel towards an INNER HATCH. He sto himself and looks back at Mullins, peering down through t open outer hatchway. Val motions for him to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins turns and looks across the deck to Kellogg. He wa him over when suddenly, behind Kellogg, starting at the v back end of the Freighter and moving forward-- The color of the red laser alarm starts CHANGING TO BLUE. Mullins notices--

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: What’s up with that? KELLOGG looks around. The blue light is almost upon him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLOGG
dialogues.text: The alarm...It’s changing! He flashes a look of abject terror at Mullins as the blue laser light BREAKS ACROSS HIS SUIT and flashes on towards Mullins. Then things happen very fast: --SLOTS open up all across the ship's deck --KELLOGG lunges for the hatch. --MULLINS raises his Z-16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks up at the sound of Mullins's voice. VAL'S POV: Mullins, visible through the open outer hatch raises his gun, just as Val's HUD flashes the STUMPER WAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kellogg is halfway out the hatch when-- TwO DOZEN STUMPERS - the nasty, bird-like mechanical robo fly out of the open slots in the deck of the ship. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They FIRE sharp, deadly LASER BEAMS at Kellogg. Mullins O UP with his Z-16. The gun slings FLAMING PLASMA BOLTS int the swarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester hurry through as their HUDS flash warn THEIR POV: Little POPS and FLASHES of light zigzag across rear deck of the ship as the wave of BLUE LIGHT advances towards them.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Oh God. They jump down the hatch and slam it SHUT as the BLUE LIG sweeps over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins BLOWS a few Stumpers apart with his gun as Kellog tries to make the hatch. But the Stumpers are too quick Three of them zero in on Kellogg and-- SHRED HIS BODY INTO RIBBONS before he knows he's hit.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: (screaming) No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks through the window of the inner hatch. Inside t ship, ALARM LIGHTS are flashing in the corridors. Val loo back up at Mullins.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (yelling) Mullins! !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins fires one last BURST into the attacking Stumpers, jumps through the open hatch. The Stumpers SWARM towards and reach the outer hatch just as Mullins pulls it SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val sweats as he furiously works on the inner hatch lock

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Val! Kellogg! -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Kellogg's gone. Mullins bounces off the walls as he reloads his Z-16 in t zero-gravity of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester hurry towards another inner hatch.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: So much for surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lock releases with a THUNK. Val looks over his should at Mullins. Mullins nods, reloaded and ready for business Val OPENS the hatch... A tornado of ATMOSPHERE rushes in. Val and Mullins are BUFFETED by the turbulence as the tin sound of LOUD ALARMS rides in on the violent air. The shaft pressurizes. Val and Mullins jump through the i hatch into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick orange MIST pumps into the corridor as Val and Mu emerge from the hatch opening.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: E.T. dust...bug spray. Val and Mullins charge through the mist and stop at a junction. Val leans cautiously around and takes a look. VAL (CONT’D) Clear. They round the corner and continue at a fast jog when a d slides open ahead of them and-- FOUR ARMED GUARDS, wearing gas masks and biohazard suits wielding machine guns, spill out They start FIRING. Val and Mullins level their Z-16s. They each let a quick BURST of plasma loose... Bolts decimate the guards and CHEW UP big chunks of wall. Tracers BLAST over Val's shoulder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and FIRES at three more guards behind the Mullins steps over and SHOOTS. The guards go down. More shots BURST into the surrounding walls. Mullins turns and exchanges FIRE with a guard darting fro behind a corner. They CRACK off a couple quick shots, the Mullins aims his gun at the corner and SHOOTS. The plasma bolts PUNCH a hole through the wall and the gu is FLUNG out from the other side, D.0O.A. Val and Mullins hurry into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val hits a button and the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Fifteen. Both men catch their breath and hold their guns at the do the levels click off their two-hundred-deck descent. 150...75...25. The elevator stops. The doors open. Val and Mullins SHOOT as they burst from the elevator int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwO MEN wearing heavy, military-style body armor and helm with mirrored visors, are ventilated by plasma bolts. Their weapons CLATTER to the floor as they fall dead. Val and Mullins run forward into more FIRING. They return SHOTS. Val moves off to his left, climbs up stairs to a s platform, FIRING as he goes. Mullins crouches to his knee RAKES the corridor with his gun. The corridor erupts in SMOKE and FLAME. Val PICKS OFF two men moving up behind Mullins then swive his gun back down on the others. Mullins stands and CHARGES with his gun BURNING. The last man FLOPS to the floor and the shooting stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins goes to the nearest dead man and kneels. The dead is wearing the heavy body armor. Mullins looks around at others -- they are all wearing it.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: These guys are Corporate Rangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Did you read that?

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Yeah. How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val looks very concerned.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Looks like a whole squad. Mullins gets back to his feet. He looks unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: (to Val) What are Corporate Rangers doing on board a deep sky freighter? Val doesn't have time to answer as-- FOUR MORE SOLDIERS come around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: ONE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons! Val and Mullins freeze. TwO MORE SOLDIERS appear behind them, weapons drawn. Val slowly lays down his Z-16. Mullins does the same.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SOLDIER
dialogues.text: On the floor! Val starts to crouch. Mullins follows, but...Val catches Mullins's eye on the way down-- AND DRAWS HIS SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He TAKES OUT a soldier with a blast from his cannon. All hell breaks loose again as the others RETURN FIRE. Mullins ROLLS and SHOOTS down the two behind him. Val FEE another his second shotgun barrel. Mullins WHEELS around finish the last one and gets-- HIS FOOT BLOWN OFF by a burp of machine gunfire. His suit DEPRESSURIZES as he goes down screaming in pain.

dialogues.speaker: MULLINS
dialogues.text: Arrggoddd! Val bifurcates the last soldier with his Z-16. Mullins, screaming, rips his helmet off and winds a tourn around the bleeding stump where his foot was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett and Lester listen to the screaming under Val's vo

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Mullins is down. I think we got ‘em all--

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Then get it together, Val! Jarrett looks at Lester, surprised by her tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val listens.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: (filtered) Blow the com frame now! We're taking the bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester nails Jarrett with a steely-eyed glare.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: We're not dropping this ball. Lester OPENS the inner hatch.  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val drags the wounded Mullins down the corridor. Mullins tries to hold his weapon ready as he hops on his good leg grits his teeth against the pain.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND A CORNER
dialogues.text: Val heaves Mullins to the wall and helps him slump down.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Cover our rear. Mullins nods, adamant. Grinds his teeth against the pain. Val lets his Z-16 hang loose on its sling and draws his C He hurries deeper down the corridor and goes to a BOX nea large YELLOW HATCH. He keys a code from memory. PULLS the handle. There is a LOUD BUZZ and the yellow hatch OPENS. Val enters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's brain. An expansive room of thin, glistening panels of a cellophane-like substance. Val goes straight to the CONTROL PANEL and starts throwin switches, lobotomizing the ship-- THERE IS MOVEMENT. Val ducks as a SHOT goes off near him. He pops back up to a lone crewman try to get off another Val raises the Colt and BUSTS OFF TWO SHOTS. The man goes down, clutching his arm and YELLING in pain. The man lift his gun again, but Val UNLOADS into him. The man dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester leads Jarrett at a fast jog to the bridge hatchway They peer through the window to see--

dialogues.speaker: THE UNARMED TEN-MEMBER CREW
dialogues.text: On the other side, panicking over their system failures a calling for help over their com lines. Lester smacks a clump of CLAY onto the hatch release. Jar breaks off the WIRE... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jarrett and Lester cover up, Jarrett glimpses TWO CORP RANGERS moving up behind them... He whirls around and SHOOTS THEM as the center of the hat MELTS in a blinding FLASH of hot liquid metal. Lester uncovers in time to see ONE CORPORATE SOLDIER emer from the smoldering hole. Lester EMPTIES her machine gun into him. He goes down. Jarrett and Lester race onto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew halts. Several throw their hands in the air. The COMMANDER approaches Jarrett and Lester, his hands up

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Show mercy on my crew and-- Lester sticks her gun against his head.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Shut it! The Commander obeys.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Status, Val?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val throws one last switch.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Disable complete. It's all ours.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Lester turns to Jarrett, speaks to Val.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Meet Jarrett at the shuttle-- A crewman panics and bolts. Lester spins like a top and SHOOTS him down without a thought. There are CRIES. Jarre looks hard at Lester, then to the Commander.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Follow my instructions and nobody else gets hurt.  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mullins slumps lower against the wall on a slow nod towar death. He stares straight ahead, his gun loose in his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val pulls off his helmet, exhausted, takes a breath and s something across the room. It's a pack of CIGARETTES, protruding from the pocket of jumpsuit hanging on the wall above a SECURITY STATION. Val goes over, grabs a cigarette and puts it in his mouth then digs through the jumpsuit pockets for a light when something at the security station forces him to look. It's a flat MONITOR -- displaying a FLOOR PLAN of the Dec Fifteen corridor. Val and Mullins appear at their respect locations as small, glowing, INFRARED SHADOWS of themselv Val touches an icon on the monitor. More floor plans are called up. The ship, grid-by-grid. Val stops on one showing a single glowing ICON moving dow corridor closely behind a group of TEN MORE ICONS represe other people on board, namely--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarrett herds the Commander and his eight remaining crew forward. They stop at the sealed hatch to the ESCAPE SHUT

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Key it. The Commander turns to Jarrett.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't-- Jarrett PUNCHES him in the nose.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: You are no longer in command of this ship. Key the code and get everybody inside.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Please...Both of the large shuttles have to be activated from the bridge. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can't even open the doors until that happens. Jarrett doesn't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: COM MAINFRAME
dialogues.text: Val calls up the BRIDGE floor plan on the security monito

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Bridge. Our friend here says the shuttle's not activated. Confirm. It shows a single glowing ICON hovering at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Lester stands near the helm. She looks intently down at a panel of status lights like she's waiting for something.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Copy, bridge? Lester hears Jarrett. But she doesn't move...

dialogues.speaker: COM MAINFRAME
dialogues.text: Val continues to SCAN every deck on the monitor, but ther no more shadows to be seen besides those of the dead sold and crewmen lying still throughout the ship.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Bridge, I need an answer on that shuttle... Then Val calls up one more floor plan... AND A SINGLE ICON APPEARS. This one is MOVING. Running.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I have movement. Foredeck, level eight. There's someone else on the ship. They're in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Lester stills at his announcement.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Headed which way?  95.

dialogues.speaker: COM MAINFRAME
dialogues.text: Val calls up a wider plan which includes the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Straight for you, bridge.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: His face tightens with worry.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Bridge?...

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: She hasn't moved. But she's looking up from the console.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Com, give me the exact location.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: He watches the glowing icon keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Two-hundred meters aft the forward bulkhead. Suddenly another MONITOR blinks to life. This one announc

dialogues.speaker: OUTBOUND COURSE SETTING RE-ROUTED
dialogues.text: Val looks at it, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) QOutbound?...I thought this ship was on its way in.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Really sweating now, worried about Lester. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Seal the bulkhead doors, Lester!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Drawn to the information on the new monitor. He calls up more. The monitor reveals:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's rapt. Then we see HIS FLASHBACK as it cuts through his mind -- Vincent talking to Lester back in the chop shop.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT
dialogues.text: I hear something about a new prison out there, on Triton.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I try to stay away from prisons. BACK ON VAL, as he looks over at the other monitor to see running ICON gaining on the bridge. He touches another icon above the running shadow.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) What's going on, Val?! The monitor goes picture-in-picture: the smaller one star to RETRACE the shadow's path backwards through the ship.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) How close, Com? Val looks at the running shadow on the larger picture.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Fifty meters. You can take 'em down anytime. The shadow's starting point on the ship is LOCKED ON. The monitor blinks: DETENTION BLOCK A - DECK FIFTEEN. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Who else is on this ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches the glowing icon approach the bulkhead doors. Again, we see HIS FLASHBACK -- Lester speaking to him in galley of the Lightrail.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Some kind of prisoner transfer going on. They've sealed the whole area. BACK ON VAL. Really CLOSE this time. His eyes are swimmin as a horrible realization starts to tick off in his head.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: About to waste the commander for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Who else?!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: The prisoner. Jarrett's caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: The man we're escorting to Triton Penitentiary. He's our only payload.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: It was classified. Some federal deal to keep it quiet. They didn’t want trouble. Isn’t that why you’re here? To break him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open wide in realization--  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already hit him. Like a wave.

dialogues.speaker: FORWARD BULKHEAD
dialogues.text: From behind, we see a man running. He carries a PISTOL in hand, his PRISONER'S UNIFORM is charred and torn. His arm and knuckles are scraped and bruised. He glances back... It's TYCHO BRAE! He hits a fire alarm button near the door.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Fueled with rage, he forgets the Commander and starts to back towards the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Lester, get outta there! It's a set- up!

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: She looks down at her finger... It rests on a switch: FORWARD BULKHEAD. She throws it.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: He skids to a stop as a BULKHEAD DOOR SHUTS in his path.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Watching Brae's ICON enter the bridge on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: He's right on you, Lester!

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Lester picks up her gun and spins around to see the bruis and battered Brae charge onto the bridge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They face each other down. Then...LESTER SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: His face falls. On the monitor, Brae and Lester's icons h MERGED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and we quickly see another FLASHBACK -- Leste talking to him in his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I've got plans of my own. BACK ON VAL. Slammed with the full truth.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: She fucked us, Jarrett! She fucked us both!

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Lester and Brae break off a raptor's kiss. Brae grins wid

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Stellar, baby. Truly stellar.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: He pounds on the sealed door in anger

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Brae!!

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae looks up, addressing Jarrett over the com line.

dialogues.speaker: BRAE
dialogues.text: I took your advice, Jarrett. I prayed. Now it’s “next time” and I see you first. Brae reaches down and turns a key in a RED SWITCH. BACK IN JARRETT’S CORRIDOR (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three quick ALARMS suddenly echo down the corridor. Jarre stops pounding and looks back at the Commander and his cr They look about, FRIGHTENED and HORRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: CREWMEN
dialogues.text: They can't! Oh my God! No!

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: What? - -

dialogues.speaker: DECK FIFTEEN
dialogues.text: Val, helmet back on, goes to Mullins, slumped dead agains wall with his eyes wide open and his Z-16 in his lap. Val spots Mullins's helmet, lying upside down next to him its visor flashing the Stumper warning. VAL'S POV: His own alarm SHORTS on, starts FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (stunned) Not inside...

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT'S CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: There is a BUZZING sound. A SWARM OF STUMPERS swoops through the corridor and desce on the crew. The crewmen SCREAM as they are DICED apart. Jarrett raises his Z-16 and FIRES. Bolts of plasma POUR i the writhing mass of Stumpers and dying crewmen.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Val!!!

dialogues.speaker: DECK FIFTEEN
dialogues.text: Val snatches up Mullins's customized Z-16 and several FUS GRENADES off his belt.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: On my way! There is the BUZZING sound. Val looks up. A HALF-DOZEN STUMPERS cruise straight down the corridor. They OPEN FIRE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val ducks as a laser blast STRIKES. He lifts the Z-16 and UNLEASHES A PLASMA STORM. Attacking Stumpers EXPLORE to pieces. Val RUNS for his life, SPRAYING the corridor behind him w his Z-16 as he goes. He rounds a corner and KILLS SEVERAL MORE STUMPERS in fro him before he smacks a lump of CLAY onto a hatch and brea the wire. He covers up as the hatch BLOWS APART, then run through the opening, FIRING as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORRIDOR JUNCTION
dialogues.text: Jarrett takes cover.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Make the Deck Fifteen junction! Jarrett FIRES on several Stumpers hovering near a hatchwa They disintegrate. He goes through the hatch into a--

dialogues.speaker: A NEW CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Jarrett takes only three steps when-- A SINGLE STUMPER gets the drop on him and FIRES. The laser SLICES across his upper chest and shoulder. Oxy BURSTS from his suit as it depressurizes.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Ahgg!!! Jarrett BLOWS the Stumper apart on his way to the floor j as Val rounds the corner at a run.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Behind! -- Val spins to a crouch and SHOOTS DOWN TWO MORE STUMPERS. Then Val looks at--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Fighting for breath, bleeding everywhere, reloading his Z and looking up at Val through bloodshot eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit, Val, what a mess... Val runs forward and glances around the corner. HIS POV: No fewer than TWENTY STUMPERS are on their way. Val turns, frantically looks around, spots something-- It's a ladder, leading to a hatch marked: ENGINE VENT ACC Val grabs Jarrett's arm...

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Come on! ...and YANKS him to his feet. Jarrett YELLS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae turns to Lester as Jarrett's SCREAMS come over the o com line.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Are all the lifeboats down?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NEW CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Jarrett leans against the wall, barely holding himself up looks at the ladder to the engine vents.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: We gotta move, now!

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: I'm dead, Val--

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Don't give me that shit!

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Val, I make the rules! I’m giving you an order! Don’t let them take us both down!! Jarrett shakes from the effort. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I screwed up--

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: We both did--

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: No. No, it's my fault, I should have told you about her, about me and her-- The BUZZING SOUND of the approaching Stumpers cuts him of But Jarrett stares into his eyes like he already knows, g Val’s hand with both of his, like a man truly realizing t end is upon him, and stands tall one last time.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Welding beams again for a living doesn’t look so bad from here... Jarrett pulls away and raises his Z-16. Val nods, gets up Runs to the engine vent ladder and starts climbing, fast. Jarrett turns around, takes a deep breath, digs deep and CHARGES around the corner...

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Jarrett runs HEAD ON into the mass of attacking Stumpers.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT
dialogues.text: Suck on this, Brae. He FIRES FULLY AUTO into the swarming machines. The corri explodes in laser strikes and plasma bolts as they clash.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VENT ACCESS SHAFT
dialogues.text: Val climbs fast up the ladder towards the hatch as Jarret LOUD SCREAMS fill his ears.

dialogues.speaker: JARRETT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Awwww! ! - - The screams abruptly turn to STATIC. Then...the BUZZING SOUND. Val whips his Z-16 down and FIRES as several Stumpers zoo into the bottom of the access shaft below him. Stumpers explode into SHRAPNEL, laser hits POP all around val. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val keeps FIRING as he hits the hatch release. The hatch irises OPEN--

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Arrgggh! Val disappears in a violent FLASH as he is-- SUCKED INTO THE ENGINE VENT SYSTEM. Stumpers SLAM against the hatch as it CLOSES them out

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Lester and Brae listen as Val's YELLING abruptly cuts out They wait a moment. Brae turns to her

dialogues.speaker: BRAE
dialogues.text: Initialize countdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val TUMBLES wildly through the zero-gravity of the vent system, CRASHING into the sides as he tries to recover fr his ride through the hatch. He snags a beam and stabilizes himself, then looks aft. The end of the shaft cannot be seen. Val swings back on the beam and PUSHES OFF, flies to the beam and does the same. He accelerates with ease in the z gravity and quickly "crawls" aft

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: As Lester readies the countdown, she glances at the bridg SECURITY MONITOR, showing the same floor plans Val saw. Val's moving SHADOW catches her attention.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Someone's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Engine vent system. He's heading for the power plant. It's val. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: He'll be burned up when we light Lester grabs her gun and pressure helmet...

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: He can get to it before then.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Get to what?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: The lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: You said they're all down.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Except the one in the engine room. It's a separate pod, on its own power -- standard antimatter regulations. Lester clamps on her helmet, activates her life support.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Let the Stumpers do it! Lester loads her gun, frustrated at Brae's ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Robo-weapons aren't allowed near antimatter containers.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Does he know that?

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: I hope not. Lester runs from the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast dim cavernous space. Looks like Hades on an overcast day. Val FLIES out of the vent into the room. Three ANTIMATTER ENGINE TOWERS rise out of the darkness b him, towering to the top of the room like harbingers of industrial genocide. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far across the room, near the top, behind a small gangway the entrance to the ESCAPE LIFEBOAT SHUTTLE -- a small spaceship set flush into the wall of the Antenora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He floats steady, contemplating the lifeboat and his esca but then turns his attention to the massive engines inste

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VENT SYSTEM
dialogues.text: Lester, fully pressurized, her gun slung over her shoulde hooks an attachment on her suit to a slot in the vent abo her. It clicks home. She tugs at it once, then-- FIRES HER BOOT THRUSTERS. She heads aft at rocket speed.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae adjusts his com headset, slips behind the helm.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Hello. Val? Tycho Brae here.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: Val clings to the bottom of one of the engines, dwarfed b scale, the room's borders dissolving into darkness. He lo like a diver at the bottom of a cold deep lake. Brae's VOICE comes through his com...

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) I'm sorry it had to work out this way, Val, but you gave me no choice... Val ignores Brae's broadcast and attaches one of the-- FUSION GRENADES to the base of the engine.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: (filtered) I was going to let you in on the whole thing had Jarrett accepted, but I didn't realize his blood was so bad for me. Then when you said no, I really had to improvise. Nothing like someone’s sense of loyalty to screw with your plans... Val sets the grenade timer to "00" and moves on.  107.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE VENT SYSTEM
dialogues.text: Lester gets closer to the engine room.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: (filtered) So I came up with something -- not money, not even glory -- but something so powerful that no man could ever turn it down...

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae starts to adjust the controls to his position.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Lester. Brae smiles to himself as he starts flipping switches.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve been pulling the strings from the beginning: Anders’ arrest, the phony Rotor Shuttle gig. I needed to make sure you found yourselves ina truly desperate situation. And Lester helped get it done. She’s one of the last of the great wicked witches, don’t you think so, Val? The bridge status monitor suddenly changes to read: COUNTDOWN DISCONTINUED -- REINSTALLED.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: Val sticks another grenade to the SECOND ENGINE and moves to the THIRD.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: They had me between prison and a hard place, Val. Val attaches his third grenade.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But now I’m a free man with a brand new ship carrying fuel and provisions to last eighty-five years...which is a lot shorter than twenty in the slam, don’t you think?  108.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae SEALS the bridge hatches and NAVIGATIONAL CHARTS app HEADS UP in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: How are we doing, Lester?

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: Val hits his thrusters and heads for the lifeboat gangway He sets the timer on his last grenade for "00:15" and loa into the launcher tube on the Z-16 as he goes. He approaches the edge of the gangway and slows when-- LESTER rushes out of nowhere to meet him. Val tries to react, but gets the butt of Lester's machine SMASHED into his visor. The Z-16 SPIRALS out of his hands he TUMBLES away from the lifeboat. Lester pushes off after him, levels her machine gun and O FIRE -- but the RECOIL knocks her reeling head over heels backwards. VAL stops his tumble and looks up. HIS GUN floats way above, near the top of the engine room Val FIRES HIS THRUSTERS and heads for it. LESTER catches her fall and BLASTS after Val. Val reaches for his gun. Lester COLLIDES with him. He doesn't make the grab. They both CAREEN into the wall. Lester pins him and GRABS for his kill switch. He DODGES, then PUNCHES her in the helmet. The blow sends them REELI until Val's harness-- SNAGS on the top of one of the ANTIMATTER ENGINE TOWERS. He tries to use THRUST to break free but Lester SWOOPS do him and PULLS HIS KILL SWITCH. His thrusters cut out, gone. Val, frantic, looks at Lester as she reaches for the OXYG HOSE into his helmet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: Did you really think even for a second that I might do it? Did you think I'd go back to Earth with you? Val's face says "Yes." Lester shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were too easy, Val. Both of you. You’re too good to be a bad guy. She starts to pull out the hose when a huge VIBRATION roc the engine tower. Lester forgets all about the hose as th room begins to fill with an ICY mist. THE ENGINES ARE POWERING UP.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (screaming) Brae! What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae has his finger on the joystick. He's ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Nothing personal, Les, but loyalty was never my thing.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE ROOM
dialogues.text: The giant vent openings CLOSE. Lester freaks out--

dialogues.speaker: LESTER
dialogues.text: No!! --just as Val gets his arm FREE. He SWATS her away and YA himself clear of the engine tower. He gives one glance back to see Lester, panicked-- GLANCE UP AT THE LIFEBOAT SHUTTLE. Val doesn't hesitate... He reaches back and RIPS HIS OXYGEN hose out of his suit. Points it down. The escaping oxygen LAUNCHES him up. Lester CHASES. Val moves FAST, breathing out as he goes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SNATCHES his gun then CRASHES onto the lifeboat gangwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds his breath and hits the hatch release. IT OPENS immediately. LIGHTS begin to FLASH as Val hauls himself through the hatch and into the lifeboat He turns around to see Lester LAND on the gangway as the engine room SHAKES WITH MASSIVE VIBRATION. Lester looks up at Val, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: LESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take me with you! VAL levels his Z-16 at her and gulps a breath.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Sorry...I’m not that good. He FIRES! The FUSION GRENADE leaves the tube and SMASHES into Leste like a supersonic hockey puck. She SAILS OUT ACROSS THE ENGINE ROOM. THE FUSION GRENADE timer clicks to "00:09".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val yanks a handle. The HATCH SEALS. Val is SLAMMED flat the floor by the G-force of instant pressurization. He gu air. Tremendous VIBRATION hits the lifeboat. Val strains against it to press the LAUNCH BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Brae yells.

dialogues.speaker: TYCHO BRAE
dialogues.text: Firing engines!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lifeboat SPIRALS up and away at a fantastic speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lester BURSTS INTO FLAMES as the ENGINES IGNITE.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is pinned to the floor of the shuttle, his face rippl with the tremendous acceleration. He uses all his strengt crane his neck back so he can see out the window. VAL'S POV: The Antenora's rocket ports FLARE and the mass ship disappears in a thin crack of LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brae watches the smeared tunnel of light-speed light thro the cockpit window. His face is gleeful.

dialogues.speaker: BRAE
dialogues.text: Speed!!! THE FUSION GRENADE timer clicks over to "00:00"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lifeboat shuttle soars upwards as a-- BLINDING MULTICOLORED WAVE OF LIGHT splits space like a thunderbolt from Zeus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val strains against the G’s to see the Antenora go "super three seconds and 558,000 miles away from him in space.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Here's to eternity. The light RIPPLES across Val's entire field of vision. Then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet now. Val sits half-undressed on the floor, bio-med sensors tap his bare chest. He smokes a cigarette and stares listless out the window at the vast blackness of space.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: He lowers himself into a SLEEP CHAMBER and opens a small of the same neon blue liquid he drank in the Cestus Club. sips it back and tosses the vial out of the sleep chamber CLOSE ON - VAL'S FACE as he drifts off to sleep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: We hear a loud, WHISTLING sound. Like a bomb falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick, matted beard now covers it. He jolts awake and l around, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The craft violently ROCKS and SHUDDERS. The instrument pa wet with condensation, SPARKS and SMOKES. Val looks out the window to see only BURNING HOT FLAME. The ROCKING grows increasingly violent. Then SUDDENLY-- It STOPS. All is calm as bright SUNLIGHT floods the shutt Val looks out again. VAL'S POV: A large vast body of WATER is visible below. It is THE PACIFIC OCEAN. Val is rushing towards EARTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parachutes break the lifeboat's fall as it SPLASHES DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small, charred craft ROCKS and PITCHES on the blue wa supported by an inflatable ring around its base. The hatch OPENS and VAL climbs out. He feels the air on h face. He breathes in a deep breath of sea-salt. There is nothing but water for as far as he can see. He squints at the horizon for a long time in complete and utter disbelief. Then he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIFEBOAT SHUTTLE
dialogues.text: Val stretches out across the top of the spaceship, lights cigarette, and leans back to catch the bright sunshine as sails the Earth. FADE OUT.
